items.description: River Windrush from Bourton to Newbridge
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels remain high but stable on the River Windrush following recent rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 29/10/24, especially in the Bourton on the Water and Newbridge areas. 
Tuesday is forecast to be mostly dry with some light rain. We expect river levels to continue slowly falling today but levels remain sensitive to rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 30/10/24, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels remain high but stable on the Ginge Brook in Steventon. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 29/10/24. Tuesday is forecast to be mostly dry with some light rain. We expect river levels to remain high over the next days. River levels remain sensitive to rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation.  Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 30/10/24, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thames, Blunsdon Brook, Water Eaton Brook, Marston Meysey Brook, Share Ditch, Bydemill Brook, Westrop Brook, Downington Brook

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels are high but falling on the River Thames following recent rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 29/10/24, especially between Cricklade and Hannington Bridge. Tuesday is forecast to be mostly dry with some light rain. We expect river levels to continue slowly falling over the next few days. River levels remain sensitive to rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation.  Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 30/10/24, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Thame, Horsenden Stream and Chalgrove Brook

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thame, Horsenden Stream, Chalgrove Brook

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels remain high but are now starting to fall on the River Thame. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible today, 29/10/24. Tuesday is forecast to be mostly dry with some light rain. We expect river levels to remain high for the next few days, but will continue to slowly fall. River levels remain sensitive to rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation.  Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 30/10/24, or as the situation changes.
This Flood Alert has been removed. River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message:
Groundwater levels have risen in response to recent rainfall. Levels are expected to remain high and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. No further rainfall is expected over the next few days.

Flooding of roads and fields is possible. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding.

Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. We will continue to monitor the situation closely.

This message will be updated by 16:00 PM on 29/10/2024.

High river levels throughout the afternoon may lead to flooding.
Flooding is possible from 12:00 noon on 28/10/2024.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Ebble, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Alvediston and Nunton.
Weather conditions are expected to improve overnight and no further flooding is expected.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and closely monitoring the situation.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 3:00 PM on 29/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Cranborne Chase area
items.message:
Groundwater levels have risen in response to recent rainfall. Levels are expected to continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. No rainfall is expected over the next few days.

Flooding of roads and fields is possible. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding.

Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. We will continue to monitor the situation closely.

This message will be updated by 16:00 PM on 29/10/2024.

We will continue to monitor river and rain levels in the area.
